entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 4:46PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rivers Rising Into This Weekend... Strong thunderstorms brought heavy rain to the Eastern Brooks Range Thursday night. This is now causing high water on rivers draining the Eastern Brooks Range, and rivers south of the mountains will continue rising this weekend. Water will cover gravel bars, and there is a chance of flooding.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:19PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson County through 200 PM MDT... At 118 PM MDT, amateur radio operators reported a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Powder River Pass, which is also 19 miles southwest of Buffalo, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:07PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hot Springs and northwestern Washakie Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 107 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southeast of Meeteetse, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
